Question: This person served as New Salem's postmaster and later as county surveyor, all the while reading voraciously.
Hints: Nevertheless, this person was concerned that Grant might be considering a candidacy for President in 1864, as McClellan was.
This person became increasingly distant from his father, in part because of his father's lack of education.
Burton (2008) argues that this person's republicanism was taken up by the Freedmen as they were emancipated.
